channel.title: Google just took over web development!
channel.description:
Google are upping their game!
http://www.google.co.uk/webdesigner/ https://developers.google.com/web/starter-kit/
What do you think?

item.title: Google just took over web development!
item.dc:creator: @Death_Style Death Style
item.description:
@Death_Style wrote:

Honestly sounds like more of a hassle to implement than just doing it.

Justin Bieber:

i just code my html and css by hand rofl

Yeah, same. I’d only be interested in this for the mobile version I’m assuming it does automatically.

Read full topic

item.title: Google just took over web development!
item.dc:creator: @Pwnd Pwnd
item.description:
@Pwnd wrote:

[quote=“Ashi, post:43, topic:544374”][quote author=Pwnd link=topic=663255.msg4433755#msg4433755 date=1404315268]
Why do things need to be updated all the time? SHEESH

I used to build my UIs in Dreamweaver, but just to use the preview button. I did all the code myself.
[/quote]
You never heard of brackets.io ?[/quote]I have, but I was comfortable with DW

That was my PHP days though. It could definitely help with building views for my Rails apps though.

Read full topic
item.source: Google just took over web development!

item.title: Google just took over web development!
item.dc:creator: @Ashi Ashi
item.description:
@Ashi wrote:

FYI LESS is shouldn’t be an option. Anybody using it is retarded (including twitter). SASS will always be better.

But at least you’re using preprocessors.

Read full topic
item.source: Google just took over web development!

item.title: Google just took over web development!
item.dc:creator: @Death_Style Death Style
item.description:
@Death_Style wrote:

[quote=“Ashi, post:41, topic:544374”][quote author=Death Style link=topic=663255.msg4433753#msg4433753 date=1404315056]
I’m a little against WYSIWYG because in my experience they aren’t clever enough to know when to use padding, margins, or positioning correctly, but that’s probably an error on my part. I think I’ll try out the web starter kit.
[/quote]
You mean web designer lol

Web starter kit is the framework :p[/quote]
I know it’s the framework. I have no interest in the web designer.

For the most part I write everything myself.

Read full topic
item.source: Google just took over web development!

item.title: Google just took over web development!
item.dc:creator: @Ecko Ecko
item.description:
@Ecko wrote:

Ruby:

Towards the thread, anyone who’s been here any length of time knows I’m a long time supporter of Foundation and always will be but it isn’t any better than Bootstrap, it’s just more obscure. Bootstrap vs Foundation is a pointless argument, it’s down to preference. People feel better using Foundation because it avoids the argument from retards like Ecko of other top level frameworks being overused and overrated.

Says the idiot who didn’t even bother checking the links from the OP to see what they actually were before making a completely ignorant comment on it. You know, that idiot who stated all these other frameworks were somehow better without even knowing what you were comparing it to.

Boostrap was recently updated and they still haven’t added form validation. Further, SASS is also significantly more extensive than LESS and allows you to do things much simpler.

You want to see a comprehensive list of comparisons? http://responsive.vermilion.com/compare.php

In before you make some asinine comment again without checking the link.

Read full topic

item.source: Google just took over web development!

item.title: Google just took over web development!
item.dc:creator: @Ruby_Forums_Coder Ruby
item.description:
@Ruby_Forums_Coder wrote:

[quote=“Ashi, post:37, topic:544374”]Actually no Ruby.

Bootstrap hasn’t been updated in a long time now. Foundation however is currently much richer then Bootstrap. Unless Twitter have plans to improve what they have now, foundation is going to be better.

Current version of foundation surpasses bootstrap.[/quote]

From what I remember F5 and BS3 were on par with each other (bear in mind I’ve not touched any development in at least 6 months) except for the fact that BS3 had a much much larger community and a lot more advanced support community whereas F5 was dead in comparison. If this is still the case then even if F5 is a little ahead of BS3 then the community itself makes up for it.

Nevertheless, I much prefer F5 but that doesn’t mean it’d be the best choice to make.

Edit, bootstrap was updated on the 26th of June… http://blog.getbootstrap.com/

Seems like bootstrap were working on it for 4 months, looking at the Foundation changelog in 4 months they still seem pretty on par http://foundation.zurb.com/docs/changelog.html so I’m not sure what you’re talking about.

Read full topic
item.source: Google just took over web development!

item.title: Google just took over web development!
item.dc:creator: @Ashi Ashi
item.description:
@Ashi wrote:

Actually no Ruby.

Bootstrap hasn’t been updated in a long time now. Foundation however is currently much richer then Bootstrap. Unless Twitter have plans to improve what they have now, foundation is going to be better.

Current version of foundation surpasses bootstrap.

item.source: Google just took over web development!

item.title: Google just took over web development!
item.dc:creator: @Ruby_Forums_Coder Ruby
item.description:
@Ruby_Forums_Coder wrote:

[quote=“SRBuckey5266, post:35, topic:544374”][quote author=The Web Guy link=topic=663255.msg4433333#msg4433333 date=1404215004]
Anyone who uses a WYSIWYG and only the design aspect of it cannot consider themselves a website developer.
[/quote]

This has to be one of the dumbest things I’ve ever heard.

It’s about using the tools you have[/quote]
Don’t worry, we’ve established in the last week that this little professional website developer is in fact retarded.

Towards the thread, anyone who’s been here any length of time knows I’m a long time supporter of Foundation and always will be but it isn’t any better than Bootstrap, it’s just more obscure. Bootstrap vs Foundation is a pointless argument, it’s down to preference. People feel better using Foundation because it avoids the argument from retards like Ecko of other top level frameworks being overused and overrated.

Read full topic

item.source: Google just took over web development!

item.title: Google just took over web development!
item.dc:creator: @Pwnd Pwnd
item.description:
@Pwnd wrote:

Foundation pain in the ass to install
Fully packed with tons of awesome shit

Bootstrap not so much a pain in the ass to install
Only gives you a CSS framework

I didn’t really get the full effect to installing Foundation because it was a gem I used in rails :3

EDIT: I don’t really remember Foundation providing all of those shnazzy things… I don’t know why I would need an HTTP server with my front-end styling framework.
EDIT #2: Unless you were talking about Google, … I am pretty ignorant to what it provides.
EDIT #3: I think the HTTP server is a bit overboard… But that’s me.

Read full topic
item.source: Google just took over web development!

item.title: Google just took over web development!
item.dc:creator: @Ashi Ashi
item.description:
@Ashi wrote:

You need to understand that this isn’t just a CSS framework that requires one line of code to implement.

I actually had difficulty setting this up at first (gulp turned out to be a pain to install). You also need sass and node.js (and something else I can’t remember).

Instead of just looking at the website, actually download it and try to use it.

I don’t see bootstrap giving you a http server, performance maintanance, cross device synchronisation etc.

Bootstrap just has more crummy components. Google are much better for responsive design. Bootstrap also has a terrible grid system. Golden ratio is so much better.

Read full topic
item.source: Google just took over web development!

item.title: Google just took over web development!
item.dc:creator: @Pwnd Pwnd
item.description:
@Pwnd wrote:

Not having to learn another framework when the one you’re using is fine, could be one reason why stick with what you got.
Your second point I can agree with, but that has nothing to do with the framework itself… That’s just you being butthurt about shit you shouldn’t even care about.

They totally should get on form validation.

I can’t say I use anything as of right now. I have tried both Foundation and Bootstrap. Both are great, to be honest.

EDIT: Just noticed the bad word filter has disappeared.

Read full topic
item.source: Google just took over web development!

item.title: Google just took over web development!

Foundation exceeded bootstrap a long time go. Idk what you people are on.

Foundation ++ bye bye Bootstrap

item.title: Google just took over web development!
item.dc:creator: @Ecko Ecko
item.description:
@Ecko wrote:

[quote=“Pwnd, post:27, topic:544374”]OVERUSED AND OVERRATED, how? It’s amazing.

Just because people don’t take the time to customize bootstrap doesn’t mean you shouldn’t use it.[/quote]
i’ve already shown how it’s overused, l2read

it’s overrated because there are much better frameworks (foundation) that one can use and a large portion of bootstrap’s user base are amateurs who hype it even though they don’t know how to utilize it properly

what’s amazing is why hasn’t bootstrap added form validation despite saying they would since before release 2

Read full topic
